com.mapgroup.classificator.filemanager.reader

Class DataReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.filemanager.reader.DataReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArffReader, dbReader, TxtReader, XlsReader

    public abstract class DataReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the way to populate and create the whole system to manage the reading dataset.

    This class is an abstract class which shares some methods which are fundamental in order to retrieve all the main aspects of the learning tree process such as the independent attribute and the dependent attribute, so called class attribute.

    From the formatted dataset file, this class provide a way to collect all the types and values for each the independent and dependent attribute.

    • Method Detail

      • initPopulator

        public abstract void initPopulator(RequestStruct rs)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes all the main instruments needed to this class in order to start the dataset reading process.

        A supplementary parameter like rs was needed in order to get all the information about the file that contains the dataset.

        Parameters:
        rs - specific information about the current request
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if some errors occurred in reading the file or in initializing the type's list

      • isDiscreteType

        private boolean isDiscreteType(java.lang.String typeName)
        Controls if the specified attribute type,typeName is a discrete attribute type or not.

        Conventionally, a discrete attribute represents an attribute which can assume only a specific number of possible values.

        A continuous attribute is represented by an attribute whose values are real numbers.

        Parameters:
        typeName - the current attribute type
        Returns:
        true if the typeName is associated to a discrete attribute, false otherwise

      • retrieveClassValue

        public final DiscreteAttribute retrieveClassValue(java.lang.Object[][] data)
        Creates the class attribute property starting from the dataset generated contained in the bidimensional structure passed to the method.
        Parameters:
        data - structured dataset
        Returns:
        the discrete class attribute

      • retrieveIndependentAttribute

        public void retrieveIndependentAttribute(java.lang.Object[][] data,
                                java.util.List<Attribute> explanatorySet)
        Retrieves from the structured dataset passed to the method, all the information and property of all the independent attributes that will be used in the learning process.

        The list of attributes could be composed of both discrete attribute or continuous attribute depending on the information contained in the typeList.

        Parameters:
        data - the structured dataset
        explanatorySet - list of all the independent attributes

      • tupleFactory

        public abstract java.lang.Object[][] tupleFactory(RequestStruct rs)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads from the formatted file that contains the dataset all the information and stores them in a proper way within a bidimensional structure.

        The structure rs also in this case, represents all the information about the request that is done and the context in which this one is done.

        Parameters:
        rs - specific information about the current request
        Returns:
        dataset read
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if some errors occurred during the dataset reading process
